page.title: 08GALA DAY IN WESTERHAM
page.content: Gala Day is celebrated each year on Spring Bank Holiday Monday. It began in 1937 after rain had spoiled the celebrations planned for the Coronation of King George Vl. On Gala Day there is a long procession that goes through the town led by a Gala Queen. The Gala Queen is crowned before the procession starts. The parade consists of decorated lorries and groups of people dressed in all sorts of costumes. After the procession everybody goes to the King George's Playing Field, where there is a funfair and some stalls. In the evening there is a torch procession and a disco. Gala Day is a happy day for everyone who lives in Westerham.
